Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with pregnant women or children?

do you know about the different insurance carriers

title: Physician Interview

title: Vice President - Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was ontacted to meet with the CHRO for an interview and asked for times that I would be available. I provided times and received an email thanking me for my quick response and letting me know she would be back in touch on a preferred time. I did not hear back. I waited as I know schedules can be difficult to work around. Instead a little more than a week since that communication, I received an email informing me that the position had been filled included below. This is not a great way to manage people's time or demonstrate respect. And, based on prior more personalized communication, this was not personalized at all. 

Thank you for applying to the Vice President - Human Resources position at Legacy Community Health Services. We are writing to inform you that the position for which you applied has been filled. If there are other positions that open that fit your qualifications, we welcome you to apply.

We appreciate your interest in employment with Legacy.

Sincerely,

Legacy Community Health Recruiting Team
Interview Questions: Not applicable because the interview was not scheduled.

title: Health Advocate Interview

Interview Questions: What do you know about public health?

title: Front Office Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions:
[Mapleridge] It didn't seem to take a long time. Maybe about two weeks to get a phone call inviting me to an  interview. Pretty straight forward at this point. When I arrived in the scheduled date I did had to wait about 10 minutes but that's okay it's a clinic. When I entered the room, I did see two of them taking a glance at my resume and I was relieved because other places do not even do that. They made sure to note that they saw I didn't have experience in my resume (no experience after college). I acknowledged that as being true. Then basically they just really just gave me the 'tell me about yourself' question and handed the interview to me because they didn't know how to do it. This was bad in my opinion because it showed that they weren't prepared to have me in and maybe were just trying to fill a quota. This is annoying because it's a waste of my time. My resume is pretty clear about my background to not waste time. I give them a rundown of my background and say that the requirements for the position were just a high school diploma and basic math etc. (This is what competency modelling is supposed to do.) From this point on they really didn't have questions, the questions you see in this comment were only brought up because I put great effort to try to create a conversation as they were clueless. I was the one asking the questions to them and interviewing them. I asked them about how they like to lead a team, clarification of job duties (no insurance verification, NO PHONE CALLS contrary to what the ad said, simply checking in patients),possible  areas they could improve on and the check-in process. You might wonder what type of questions  they could ask someone without experience, the answer is hypothetical questions. 

They told me that in a week I would receive a response but I was left with no answer. This is expected in today's job market however, I did expect a little better from them since they talk about sympathy for patients. I had made sure to tell them that as a patient of Legacy I had first hand experience with what interactions were in the front desk. Oh well. I wouldn't encourage someone looking for a first job to apply here.
Interview Questions: Have you done customer service before?

title: Healhcare Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with Recruiter from Insperity and if okay, then resume and notes from chat were referred to client's HR Manager who conducted a telephone interview which lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions:
1.	What do you know about Legacy Community Health?
2.	What is your recruiting strategy?
3.	How many requisitions are you accustomed to handling?
4.	At what company, did you work on that number of requisitions?
5.	What were your most challenging positions for which you have recruited?
6.	What were your least challenging positions for which you have recruited?
7.	In your current position, what do you like the most about it?
8.	In your current position, what do you like the least about it?
9.	Are you familiar with conducting background checks and drug screen requests?
10.	What Applicant Tracking Systems have you used?
11.	What Applicant Tracking System are you currently using?

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, took about 3 months for them to weed out the candidates and make a decision. I enjoyed my time but for PHS you will be placed on the spot. Be prepared to be asked to present something in a creative way!
Interview Questions: Standard questions, in the past how have you handled X.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy. Straight forward questions and very nice people.  Interview took about 30 minutes with both the director and supervisor.  A tour of the call center was provided after the interview was completed. Received a call about a week after from the supervisor stating that I was being offered the position. Overall, the interview was average.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you applied to this position?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an extremely slow response time frame after each interview round. After the final round it was close to six weeks before I was notified of a decision on the position.
Interview Questions: How I would deal with physicians.

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Legacy Community Health Services (Houston, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying for a new position within the company, it takes about three weeks before anyone gives you a call to arrange a meeting. When the first interview takes place, all goes well and then there is another formal interview. The candidate then waits until they hear back from the hiring team, but they usually have to keep asking or reminding someone that they are awaiting a response.
Interview Questions:
How do you  like working with Legacy and what do you bring to the team?
What do you like about Legacy?
How wold you access said patient file and account for all of their procedures for the grant funding?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
